messages.subject: Re: Unschooling reading material suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: ... everyone could suggest. Home Education Magazine The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffiths www.sandradodd.com www.unschooling.com Life is good. ~Mary
messages.messageBody:
>>I was wondering what books/magazines related to unschooling that
everyone could suggest.>>

Home Education Magazine
The Unschooling Handbook by Mary Griffiths
www.sandradodd.com
www.unschooling.com

Life is good.
~Mary

messages.subject: Re: [Unschooling-dotcom] Unschooling reading material suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: ... It s not a book or magazine and it s hard to take into the bathroom with you ;-) but the message boards of Unschooling.com :-) It s hearing real people
messages.messageBody:
on 4/26/03 11:48 PM, Olga at britcontoo@... wrote:

> I was
> wondering what books/magazines related to unschooling that everyone
> could suggest.

It's not a book or magazine and it's hard to take into the bathroom with you
;-) but the message boards of Unschooling.com :-) It's hearing real people
talk about their real experiences and feelings and thoughts that helped me
get unschooling!

Joyce

messages.subject: Re: Unschooling reading material suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: Olga, David Albert s two books are great.  I just finished the new one. They are:  And the skylark sings with me and Homeschooling and the Voyage of Self
messages.messageBody:
Olga,
David Albert's two books are great. I just finished the new one.
They are: And the skylark sings with me and Homeschooling and the
Voyage of Self Discovery. I also liked Nancy Wallace's books though
it's been a while and I'm not sure if they are
completely "unschooly". They are: Better Than School and Child's
Work. Might have to check the library for them. Grace Lewellyn's
Real Lives gave me a hint of what to expect when the kids are older.
Kristin

--- In Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com, "Olga" <britcontoo@a...>
wrote:
So far, I have read some of Holt's books, Linda
> Dobson, and just subscribed to lifelong learning.

messages.subject: Unschooling reading material suggestions
messages.msgSnippet: Hi, Since I am very new to this you will have to excuse the immense amount of questions you will probably be getting from me!  I was wondering what
messages.messageBody:
Hi,

Since I am very new to this you will have to excuse the immense
amount of questions you will probably be getting from me! I was
wondering what books/magazines related to unschooling that everyone
could suggest. So far, I have read some of Holt's books, Linda
Dobson, and just subscribed to lifelong learning. Very slim thus far
so I would love to start getting suggestions. I have already ordered
some of the books you guys have mentioned in passing!

Thanks,
Olga
